intro: Hieracium fuscum, commonly known as the brown hawkweed, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads composed of numerous small florets. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm, featuring basal and alternate leaves that are hairy and often lobed. Its flowers are yellow and bloom from late spring to early autumn, attracting various pollinators. Hieracium fuscum is often found in meadows, grasslands, and along roadsides, thriving in well-drained soils.
